Description: Rim and body sherd with handle root (mended from four fragments, including 1888,0601.248, and added plaster) of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: on rim, dilute lines between black lines; wall glazed; top of lip glazed; exterior: lip and handle zone reserved with line between, glazed below with reserved band on lower wall; glazed black on handle root; inscription on interior of lip.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B3 (possibly)
Curator's comments: Although Schlotzhauer does not discuss this sherd, he does discuss the joining British Museum 1888,0601.248 and identifies it as coming from a Type 9C South Ionian cup with everted rim. Type 9C cups correspond to Attic Siana or Gordion cups and find parallels with Hayes' Ionian Cup Type X (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116) and Vallet and Villard's Ionian Cup type B3 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. Type 5 cups are rare at Naukratis whereas there are numerous examples of Type 9 cups. Both types were common drinking vessels found in Greeks sanctuaries, including the sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus. The sherd joins British Museum 1888,0601.248.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.703) (Phase 3)
